rajawali.primitives

Class Sphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • rajawali.renderer.AFrameTask
      • rajawali.ATransformable3D
        • rajawali.Object3D
          • rajawali.primitives.Sphere
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Object3D>, IGraphNodeMember, INode

    public class Sphere
extends Object3D
    A sphere primitive. The constructor takes two boolean arguments that indicate whether certain buffers should be created or not. Not creating these buffers can reduce memory footprint.

    When creating solid color sphere both createTextureCoordinates and createVertexColorBuffer can be set to false.

    When creating a textured sphere createTextureCoordinates should be set to true and createVertexColorBuffer should be set to false.

    When creating a sphere without a texture but with different colors per texture createTextureCoordinates should be set to false and createVertexColorBuffer should be set to true.

    Author:
    dennis.ippel

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sphere

        public Sphere(float radius,
      int segmentsW,
      int segmentsH)
        Creates a sphere primitive. Calling this constructor will create texture coordinates but no vertex color buffer.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the sphere
        segmentsW - The number of vertical segments
        segmentsH - The number of horizontal segments

      • Sphere

        public Sphere(float radius,
      int segmentsW,
      int segmentsH,
      boolean createTextureCoordinates,
      boolean createVertexColorBuffer)
        Creates a sphere primitive.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the sphere
        segmentsW - The number of vertical segments
        segmentsH - The number of horizontal segments
        createTextureCoordinates - A boolean that indicates whether the texture coordinates should be calculated or not.
        createVertexColorBuffer - A boolean that indicates whether a vertex color buffer should be created or not.
